intro: Halocharis hispida, commonly known as the rough halocharis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Halocharis hispida is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
